bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A forest development plan referred to in subsection (1) remains in effect until whichever happens first,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the agreement for which the plan was prepared expires and is not replaced or is cancelled, surrendered or otherwise terminated,
the plan is replaced with a woodlot licence plan prepared in accordance with this Act, or
subject to subsection (4), the later of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: December 31, 2006, and
the end of the term specified in the approval of the plan.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council by regulation

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may substitute a date that is no later than December 31, 2006 for the date referred to in subsection (1), and
may substitute a date that is no later than December 31, 2007 for the date referred to in subsectionÂ (3)Â (c)Â (i).

bcl:editorialnote.in:em: [Note: B.C. Reg. 361/2006 substituted December 31, 2007 for the date referred to in subsectionÂ (3)Â (c)Â (i).]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Areas under a forest development plan

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A holder of a woodlot licence who has a forest development plan referred to in section 199 or 200 must prepare, in accordance with the Code and the Code regulations, any

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: amendments to the plan or replacement of the plan, and
site plans

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: that are required under the Code.

A holder of a woodlot licence who carries out a forest practice on an area under a forest development plan or site plan referred to in subsection (1) must comply with the requirements of the Code and the Code regulations that pertain to the holder for the area.

Despite section 12, before a holder of a woodlot licence obtains approval of a woodlot licence plan, the holder may apply for a cutting permit, road permit or road use permit in accordance with the Code and the Code regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Effect of approval of a woodlot licence plan

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A woodlot licence plan approved under section 16 replaces any forest development plan that, on the date the woodlot licence plan was approved, was in effect for the woodlot licence area.

Any site plan information in a forest development plan at the time of its replacement under subsection (1) by a woodlot licence plan continues to be applicable for cutblocks in the woodlot licence area that have been harvested or are subject to a cutting permit.
The replacement under subsection (1) of a forest development plan by a woodlot licence plan does not affect a site plan prepared before the replacement.

If a performance requirement under this Act conflicts or is inconsistent with a performance requirement in a site plan referred to in subsection (3), the performance requirement in the site plan prevails.
The holder of a woodlot licence plan may amend the site plan information referred to in subsection (2) in accordance with the Code and the Code regulations.

Subject to section 204 of this Act and to section 99 (2) of the Energy Resource Activities Act, the holder of a licence to cut who harvests timber under a licence to cut entered into before the effective date must comply with the requirements of the Code and the Code regulations that pertain to the licence.

Subject to section 204 of this Act and to section 99 (2) of the Energy Resource Activities Act, a holder of a licence to cut entered into on or after the effective date who harvests timber under the licence must comply with the requirements of this Act, the regulations and the standards that pertain to the licence.
This section does not apply to a holder of a licence to cut that is granted under a pulpwood agreement.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Licences to cut that provide for cutting permits

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 99 (2) of the Energy Resource Activities Act, a holder of a licence to cut who harvests timber on an area under a cutting permit issued under the licence that is in effect on the effective date must comply with the requirements of the Code and the Code regulations that pertain to the area.

Subject to section 99 (2) of the Energy Resource Activities Act, a holder of a licence to cut who harvests timber on an area under a cutting permit issued under the licence after the effective date must comply with the requirements of this Act, the regulations and the standards that pertain to the area.

A range use plan prepared or approved under the Code that is in effect immediately before the effective date is deemed to be a range use plan under this Act and remains in effect until whichever happens first,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the agreement for which the plan was prepared expires and is not replaced or is cancelled, surrendered or otherwise terminated,
the plan is replaced with a range use plan or a range stewardship plan prepared in accordance with this Act, or
subject to subsection (3), December 31, 2006.
[Repealed 2005-2-8.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the circumstances in subsection (1) (a) to (c) have not occurred, the person who prepared a range use plan referred to in subsection (1), whether the district manager or the holder, remains responsible for preparing

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any amendments to the plan, or
any replacement of the plan

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: required under the Code and the Code regulations.
The Lieutenant Governor in Council by regulation may substitute a date that is no later than December 31, 2007 for the date referred to in subsectionÂ (1)Â (c).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requirements for areas under a grandparented range use plan

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 32, a holder of an agreement under the Range Act who has a range use plan referred to in section 205 may graze livestock, cut hay or carry out any other range practice on Crown range to which the agreement applies if, on the effective date, that grazing, hay cutting or other range practice was authorized.

If a holder of an agreement under the Range Act referred to in subsection (1) carries out grazing, hay cutting or any other range practices on an area, the holder must do so only in accordance with the requirements of the Code and the Code regulations that pertain to the area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Effect of approval of a range use plan or range stewardship plan under sectionÂ 37

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Any

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: range use plan, or
range stewardship plan

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: approved under section 37 replaces any range use plan referred to in section 205 in effect on the date of the approval for the part of the area under that plan that is in the area under the plan referred to in paragraph (a) or (b).

As soon as practicable after the approval under subsection (1) of a range use plan or range stewardship plan, the holder of the plan must graze any livestock on the area under the plan in accordance with section 45.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: participant means a person who has given his or her consent to take part in a pilot project;
pilot project regulation means a Code regulation made under section 221.1 of the Code;
proposed pilot project means a pilot project initiated under Part 10.1 of the Code if, immediately before the effective date,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the pilot project had been made subject to review and comment under that Part, and
there was not a pilot project regulation associated with the pilot project.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A pilot project regulation remains in effect despite the repeal of Part 10.1 of the Code.
Subject to this Division, the Code and the Code regulations apply to participants who are subject to a pilot project regulation.
Subject to subsection (2), a regulation may be made for a proposed pilot project as if section 221.1 of the Code were still in force.

A regulation may not be made under subsection (1) if any of the participants in the proposed pilot project notifies the minister in writing that the participant no longer consents to the proposed pilot project.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Pilot project regulation may be transferred from Code

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A pilot project regulation under the Code is deemed to be a pilot project regulation made under this Act.
If a pilot project

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has been proposed under section 221.1 of the Code, and
the proposal is still proceeding at the time of the coming into force of this subsection,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: anything done on or before the effective date in furtherance of the proposal is deemed to have been done under this Act and the proposal may be continued under and in conformity with this Act.

The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations respecting varying the requirements or the application of this Act or of the regulations, as he or she considers necessary or desirable in order to adapt them for the purposes of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a pilot project regulation referred to in subsection (1), or
a pilot project that has been proposed, and is proceeding, as described in subsection (2).

bcl:section.bcl:text: This Division applies despite anything in Divisions 1 to 8.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: outstanding requirement means a requirement under the Code that, on the specified date,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is in effect and has not been fulfilled,

is an obligation, described in section 162.1 of the Code, of the holder of an agreement under the Forest Act, that is continuing, because it is not among the obligations that, in accordance with that section, the holder was conclusively deemed to have met, or

is an obligation that is a "prescribed obligation" referred to in section 162.2 of the Code and is continuing, because the person who has the obligation has not been granted the relief described in that section;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: specified date means the date, not earlier than January 1, 2008, that is specified for the purposes of this definition by a regulation made under this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations respecting outstanding requirements, including but not limited to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: specifying outstanding requirements that continue on and after the specified date to apply to the persons to whom those requirements applied immediately before that date, and
varying those requirements or the application of those requirements as he or she considers necessary or desirable to adapt those requirements for the purposes of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The outstanding requirements to which a regulation under this section pertains are conclusively deemed to continue as requirements under this Act and to be administered and enforced as such.

Subject to the regulations made under this section or under section 178, a reference in a provision of the Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act to a repealed provision of that Act is deemed to be a reference to that repealed provision as it was before its repeal.
In accordance with the regulations, the board must carry out periodic independent audits and may carry out special investigations to determine

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: compliance with the requirements of this Part and the regulations and standards in relation to this Part, and
the appropriateness of government enforcement pertaining to this Part.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In accordance with the regulations, the board must deal with complaints from the public respecting prescribed matters that relate to a person's compliance with Parts 3 to 5 of the Code and with the Code regulations in relation to those Parts.
Part 8 applies to an audit or investigation under subsection (1) and a complaint investigation under subsection (1.1) of a person's compliance with the Code and the Code regulations.
In accordance with the regulations, the board may request the minister to review the approval of, or the giving effect to, a forest development plan or range use plan or an amendment to either if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the approval was made, or the plan or amendment was given effect, after the effective date as defined in section 177, and
the request for review was made not later than 45 days after

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the notice of the approval was given to the holder of the approved plan, or
the date on which the plan or amendment was given effect.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In accordance with the regulations, the board must carry out periodic independent audits and may carry out special investigations to determine

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: compliance with Part 5 of the Code and with the Code regulations in relation to that Part, and
the appropriateness of government enforcement pertaining to that Part.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In accordance with the regulations, the board must deal with complaints from the public respecting prescribed matters that relate to a person's compliance with Part 5 of the Code and with the Code regulations in relation to those Parts.

Part 8 of this Act applies to an audit or investigation under subsection (1) and a complaint investigation under subsection (1.1), of a person's compliance with Part 5 of the Code and with the Code regulations in relation to that Part.
